summary: The User Interface Designer presented three different concepts to consider for the user interface and introduced the idea of using speech recognition in the design of the remote. The team discussed the issue of using speech recognition at length. The Industrial Designer presented possible materials to use in making the case for the remote, introduced the option of using a solar battery, and discussed options for buttons. The Marketing Specialist  discussed recent findings from trend watching reports. The team discussed what materials to use and their interface concept.
actions: The Industrial Designer will work on the look and feel of the design, the ease of use of the design, the characteristics of being powerful and fancy, and the speech recognition aspect. The User Interface Designer will work on adding a spongy quality to the buttons and the shape of the remote. Two members of the team will work on creating a prototype made of clay
decisions: The team will not use the intelligent controller proposed by the User Interface Designer. The remote will be technologically innovative. The team will mix the concepts of the Google controller and the fancy controller in their design. The remote will use solar energy. The remote will use low level chips. The case of the remote will be made of wood. The remote will have LCD buttons. The remote will use speech recognition for simple commands.
problems: Using speech recognition in the remote. Whether to have a case that is made of wood or is spongy.

pens.ocr_description:
This image contains handwritten notes that discuss various topics related to a concept or product design. Here's a breakdown of the content:

1. **Conceptual Ideas**:
   - Mention of "Google controller" which should be easy-to-use and sophisticated.
   - References to "fancy" and "intelligent" designs.

2. **Features**:
   - Voice recognition and gesture recognition.

3. **Materials**:
   - Use of materials like wood or plastic.

4. **Power Source**:
   - Solar energy and battery-based alimentation.
   - Combination of solar energy and battery for ecology.

5. **Additional Notes**:
   - Reference to low-level chips and LED buttons made from wood.
   - Use of vocal commands and simple ones.

The image seems to be a brainstorming sketch for a technological gadget, focusing on sustainable materials and cutting-edge features like voice and gesture recognition.

doc.content:
[ABSTRACT]

This first meeting was just to be in touch with all the other members of the group.

 Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]

	No real decision was taken.

	Participants discussed about their role in the remote control creation process.

	Decide at the end of the meeting to draw some animal on the white board.

	



	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	Participants were not really feeling well in their role.

	Problem between the interface user designer and the industrial designer: which role for each of them.

	But problem solved after discussion with the two other members.

	*Emphasize the problem of the price of the remote control: not too expensive and “international”

	



	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS] 

	Industrial and user interface design: propositions for the remote control

	Market study and propositions for a sellable remote control

	Prepare next meeting for the project manager

[ABSTRACT]   

The meeting offered to each participant to do a presentation on their views on the remote control. Design requirements were discussed and some problems were also discussed.

Each of the participants had the opportunity to present their opinion and to make propositions.

The work that still has to be done has been dispatched between the participants, according to their function.

Some questions are still opened to discussions, but the overall meeting was constructive.

 

 

 

 

 

 

	[DECISIONS]  

	It was decided to create a fancy, easy-to-use remote control. The functions has to be easily accessible, with as few buttons as possible.

	David Jordan = User interface designer  sophisticated functions, powerfull and easy-to-use

	Baba = Industrial designer proposed to use the international standards in the sign choice: everyone will be able to understand these signs and it will be more intuitive.

	The industrial designer proposed to use the infrared technology: only 8euros per remote control to use this technology, and to have a wireless remote control.

	Florent Monay = Market expert: the remote control has to look fancy (75% of users find it ugly), to be very simple to use, and take care of the health of people as some functions are used intensively (zapping).

	The choice of the colour for the remote control has to be the company colour. The remote control must be associated to be company, through it look and also through the slogan company.

	It is why it has been decided to create a fancy and fashion remote control with all the basic functions to interact with a television.



	 

	 

	 

	 

	  

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	The problem of the ease of use of the remote control and the fact that it has to be powerful has been discussed.

	The question of the wireless or not wireless remote control is still opened to further discussions.

	The problem of the appearance of the remote control has to be taken into account: proposition of a yellow line on the remote control, as the choice of a personal colour will increase the price of the remote control.

	

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]

	Presentation by each member of the team, according to their job of the proposition for the remote control 

	Discussion about the functionalities and the overall look of the remote control.

[ABSTRACT]   

The conceptual design phase was very interesting. Our interface user designer proposed different concepts of remote control. We decided to create a fancy, easy-to-use, fashion  and techonologically advanced remote control.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]  

	The concept for the remote control will be the following:

	-google controller = easy-to-use and powerful

	-fancy controller = fashion look

	Concerning the material used:

	-wood with low-level chip

	-LCD buttons

	Technology added to the remote control: voice recognition for simple command

	Added value: solar energy and battery: would attract ecologist consumers. 


	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	Fashion in Paris and Milan: fruit and vegetables

	Need of a “spongy” remote control.

	Choice of the material = wood, not very spongy: use instead spongy 


	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  

	Discussions about the concept of the remote control

	Final discussion about the choice of the material = wood and LCD buttons, with cheap chip

	Evaluation of the clay remote control

[ABSTRACT]  

The designers showed to the Project Manager and the Market expert their prototype.

An evaluation was done and the cost was calculated.

The product has been adopted by all the members of the team 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]  

	Modify the mushroom shape into a pine-apple shape.

	Chose black and yellow colours, use plastic instead of wood, only one solar cell

	Marketing on the ecological part of the product: solar energy


	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	Problem with the cost of the product: reduce the cost with simpler material and only the society color.

	Problem with the ergonomy and the usability of the remote control: maybe some real-time test would be interesting to do

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  

	Evaluation of the product on a consumer sample

[ABSTRACT}

The meeting was about  the kick off of a project to design a tv remote control.  It’s main purpose was to meet the other person involved in the project and  and attend to the kick off  presentation of the project manager defining the main direction.

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]

	

	No decision was really taken. It was just an introduction meeting. 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES]

	-no special problem



	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  

	each member has to:

	-prepare presentation for the next meeting

[ABSTRACT]

The meeting was about a first serious discussion about the design of the tv remote control. First the UID has to propose his idea about the design. The ID had to give his toughts about the best electronic components and the ME give a first bench of marketing studies.



	 

	[DECISIONS]

	the decisions are:

	a fancy design of the remote control with the logo and color of the Company 

	an very efficient electronic design


	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	-wireless or not wireless remote control? That was the question

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  

	-design new user interface for UID

	-design new electronic sytem for ID

	-marketing studie  by ME

[ABSTRACT]   

This meeting was to define the definite component aspect and component of the remote control based on the point of view of the UID, ID and ME

 

 

	 [DECISIONS]   

	The decisions were:

	-the remote control energy alimentation will be solar energy based with low level chips and wooden made

	- the user graphical interface will be “google and fancy” based according to what sait M. Jordan the UID with lcd button  and some voal commands.
 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES]

	-serious argumentations about the need of vocal and gesture commands due to their lack of reliability and the difficulty to make them universal.

	  

	[ACTIONS]  

	

	-UID: look and feel

	-ID: show a first release version of the remote control

ABSTRACT

This meeting was to show the prototype resulting of our work and evaluating the work in itself. The prototype was accepted by all the team. 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   

	-accept the prototype

	-evaluate the work

	


	 [PROBLEMS/ISSUES] 

	-tough  discussion  about how easy using the remote control is .

	


	 [ACTIONS]  

	

	- this is the last meeting. There is  no other steps, just filling the questionnaries.

Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

The meeting aims to discuss relevant issues of designing a new remote TV controller, including function design, UI design and marketing issues. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	The financial issues about the new remote TV controller, including price, cost and budge.

	Function design for the remote TV controller

	UI design for the remote TV controller

	Marketing design for the remote TV controller

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 

	 

	There seem no difficulties with the meeting. Everyone is quite cooperative and agreeable each other.

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.





The Manger: will mange all issues of the new remote TV recorder.

The Industry design: will in charge of designs regarding technique functions.

The UI design: will in charge of designs regarding user interface

The Marketing Manager: will in charge of making marketing plan for the new product

Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 

We discuss specific issues regarding design of a new remote TV controller, including UI design, function design and marketing issues.

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 

	Sophisticated functions with easy-to-use user interface

	powerful functions with relatively low cost

	less button with fancy outlook

	without integrating too many functions, such as internet, recording …

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	 

	 

	balance between cost and functions

	balance between fancy and easy-to-use

	should we integrate more function or keep it specific

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.





Manger: manage the project and coordinate roles of UI, function and market designers.

For UI designer: more specific plan for UI design.

For function designer: how to balance more functions and low cost.

For marketing designer: investigate what meet users’ need.

Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 



Discuss the specific details on product UI design, function design and marketing issues. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	Easy-to-use controller with sophisticated functions

	Fancy controller with attractive out looking

	Use solar energy

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	whether to integrate intelligence functions in the controller

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.



work on the product prototype

discuss on the product prototype

make some concrete plan for the details of the product

Dear Colleague,

 

Would you be so kind to report to me on the past meeting? Please keep in mind that your notes are part of the project documentation – among other things, they will be used by myself and other staff to stay informed about the state of the project. It is therefore essential that your notes – though kept short - are of high quality. In particular:

 

Do not use any abbreviations. 

Write notes that are understandable for somebody who was not present during the meeting 

 

The head of your department

		 

 

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

 We discussed, evaluated and made a final decision on the product prototype.

 

 

 

 

 

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	We made final decisions on the specifics of the product, including colour, material, and shape.

	We made final decisions on battery of the controller.

	We made evaluations on the prototype from three aspects: fancy, easy to use, functions.

	We made a cost calculation of the cost of the product.

	

	 

	 

	 

	

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.



	It is hard to evaluate the prototype since different people may have different preferences. Therefore, we need to have hot discussion to achieve agreements on many issues.

	It is hard to balance the cost and functionality of the product. If we want to have more functionality in the products, the cost will increase. Otherwise, if we want to decrease the product cost, it is hard to integrate more functions in the product. 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.







market investigation of the product

Conduct survey on how much percentage of the custom would have a new controller (with less cost and new functions) to replace their old one.

Make profit from the new product. 

Design new products to keep company steadily growth.

ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective

The project manager described the goal of the remote control project in term of selling price, cost and clients. Each participant draw his favourite animal on the whiteboard. A short discussion about the difference between an Industrial Designer (ID) and User Interface Designer (UID) took place.

 

[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.

 

 - The remote control has to be original, trendy and user friendly *

 - remote control must be international *

 - selling price must be lower than  25 Euros, while cost can not be over 12.5 Euros  

	 

	 

	[PROBLEMS/ISSUES] Name the problems or difficulties that occurred during the meeting. Mark those that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	 - 

	 

	[ACTIONS]  Name the next steps that each member will take until the next meeting. Write fragmented notes.

	 

	-

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.



Each participant presented his opinions or studies about the way the remote control should be designed. The user interface designer emphasized the fact that the remote control needs to be elegant and easy to use (similarly to Google). The industrial designer proposed to use infrared technology to meet the cost reqirements, and I presented a user study showing that the user wants a fancy and simple remote control with a minimum number of buttons. Baba's wired remote control did not make the overall agreement, while the yellowish design proposed by the project manager did.

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

The goal of this meeting was to discuss the crucial points necessary for a first prototyping. Solar power supply will be used and part of the material will be wood, as brought by the industrial designer Baba. The user interface designer David pushed for speech and gesture recognition, but it was discussed to be a risky technology for a first implementation. The fashion trends are fruits and vegetables, and the fancy look-and-feel seems to be the key point from a user point a view. Decisions have been made at the end of the meeting.

ID look and feel design

UID user interface design

ME product evaluation

[ABSTRACT]   Write one paragraph of coherent text to summarize the meeting as a whole from your role’s perspective.

 

A presentation of the remote control prototype has been made by Baba and David. It is mainly based on a rotating yellow ball (lemon like?) to zap between channels with a coarse-to-fine strategy. A base with solar cells reloads the device. I conducted an evaluation of the prototype based on three criteria: (i) Fancy Look and Feel, (ii) Technologically Innovative, (iii) Easy to use. This evaluation gave a good score to the solution (mean of 3 on a 1 to 7 scale, 1 being ‘yes’). The main point of this meeting was a necessary redesign of the solution to reach the 12.50 Euros cost goal.   

	 

	[DECISIONS]   Name all decisions that were made during the meeting. Mark those decisions that you consider of high importance for your role with a *. Write fragmented notes.


	from five buttons to one

	from lemon to pineapple shape

	wood to plastic*

	red to black*
